action.action-desc: Mr. Kelly of Pennsylvania (for himself, Mr. Murphy, and Mr. Smith of New Jersey) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to treat membership in a health care sharing ministry as a medical expense, and for other purposes.

section.header: Treatment of health care sharing ministries as a medical expense and not as insurance

subsection.text: Section 213(d)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking or at the end of subparagraph (C), by striking the period at the end of subparagraph (D) and inserting , or, and by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: for membership in a health care sharing ministry (as defined in section 5000A(d)(2)(B)(ii) without regard to subclause (IV) thereof), includingâ€”

clause.text: the sharing of medical expenses with respect to such ministry, and
the payment of administrative fees of such ministry.

subsection.header: Health care sharing ministry not treated as a health plan or insurance

paragraph.text: Chapter 79 of such Code is amended by inserting after section 7702B the following new section:

section.header: Treatment of health care sharing ministries
section.text: For purposes of this title, a health care sharing ministry (as defined in section 5000A(d)(2)(B)(ii) without regard to subclause (IV) thereof) shall not be treated as a health plan or as insurance.

paragraph.text: The table of sections for chapter 79 of such Code is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 7702B the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 7702C. Treatment of health care sharing ministries.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
